moves.1. e4 c5 2. c3: a move that become very popular lately.
moves.2... d5 3. Nf3 dxe4 4. Qa4+ Nc6 5. Qxe4: the white queen is out early. it will be a pursuit center during Black's development.
moves.6. Qa4 Bd7 7. Bb5 a6 8. Bxc6 Bxc6: white is playing only with his queen and not developing other pieces.
moves.10. Qe2 Qxe2+ 11. Kxe2 O-O-O 12. Re1 Bb5: all white's queen side pieces are not in the game!
moves.14. Kc2 Bd3+ 15. Kb3 c4+ 16. Ka4 Rd5: it seems that a mate is in the air.
moves.18... Bc2+: worth considering is: 18... b5  and then a) 19. Ka3 a5 20. h3 (20. Bb2? axb4  21. cxb4 Ra5#) Nxf2 and next is axb4, Ra5 , Bxb4. b) 19. Ka5 Kb7! and can't prevent Bd6-Bc7#.
moves.19. Ka3 Nxf2 20. Re5 Nd3: white is laying without three pieces. it is only a matter of time...
trying to get some space.
